name: 3,3,3-trifluoro-2-hydroxy-2-(trifluoromethyl)propionic acid
Reason: 3,3,3-trifluoro-2-hydroxy-2-(trifluoromethyl)propionic acid has a melting point that we will predict by analyzing its structural components. The trifluoromethyl group (CF3) is known to increase the melting point due to its high molecular weight and rigidity. Each trifluoromethyl group can contribute around +20 to +30°C to the melting point. The hydroxyl group (OH) can also contribute to the melting point due to its ability to form hydrogen bonds, which can increase the molecular weight and rigidity. The carboxylic acid group (COOH) can also contribute to the melting point due to its ability to form hydrogen bonds and its rigidity.
